item.title: 2022.03.11 - Daily Notes (Friday)
item.description:
🌨 Light snow, mist +19°F

I'm going to try leaving off the tag on these entries until later in the day, so that when the item shows up in RSS feeds, there's something there to read.

It's funny, 'cause it's true:

Me: I would like five ice cubes
Fridge: here's two
Me: okay three more
Fridge: okay here's 27 ice cubes scattered across your entire kitchen

— Dieter Bohn (@backlon) March 11, 2022

I spent an hour yesterday looking through the Textpattern documentation after seeing a website built with it. I used Textpattern for my blog for a year or two, but that was a very long time ago. Wonder why I'm looking at it again now?

After reading a Micro.blog thread on Espanso, I learned it's available on macOS so I'm giving it a try.

And after that whole RSS Feed thing yesterday, I learn about this: saqimtiaz/tw5-feeds: Experimental plugin to add support for RSS and JSON feeds to TiddlyWiki

It's cool that things I put into Daybook.org and Events.org and Todo.org files all show up nicely in my Emacs agenda view. The problem is I never go back and look at prior days in my agenda.

This is wild: Introducing LiveStory: Make Your Family Photos Speak - MyHeritage Blog

I've failed Wordle in 3 out of my last 5 attempts. I suck at Wordle.

item.title: 2022.03.10 - Daily Notes (Thursday)
item.description:
It's possible that I now have an RSS feed for this wiki. Let me know if it doesn't work for you: https://wiki.baty.net/rss.xml. I know, I know, one of the "features" of the wiki is that I can post stuff without it bothering anyone. On the other hand, it's kind of a nuisance when it's me looking to see what other people have been writing, so I'm making it easier for people like me to follow someone like me :).

Well darn, it seems like every time I update and republish the wiki, the RSS feed gets a new entry if the daily tiddler has changed. That's not ideal, of course. UPDATE: I've added a guid element to try and prevent this. Let's see if it works. UPDATE 2: Seems to work.

I'd canceled my MicroDotBlog subscription but today it finally expired. I didn't like how that felt so I re-subscribed immediately :). Still at jack.micro.blog

item.title: 2022.03.09 - Daily Notes (Wednesday)
item.description:
☀️ Clear +27°F

One of those days, I see.

Your channel would be better without those LEDs in the background.

I had this crazy thought today of simply copying and pasting each day's note from here into Substack. You know, like that newsletter I was trying last year.

Introducing the Substack app. Remember when Substack was a newsletter tool?

item.title: Integrating Org's Agenda into Calendar.app
item.description:
The following Elisp code exports your Org mode agenda files to an iCalendar file. iCalendar (or ICS) is a standard for exchanging calendaring information. If you host this file on a web server, it can be consumed by any calendar application that supports iCalendar.

Integrating Org mode Agenda into other calendar apps

This is one-way (Org->Calendar) but that's mostly how I roll, anyway. I've included my Daybook in the agenda, which means I also get a list of things I logged each day in my Calendar app.
